item.title: Melissa add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Good books are as friends, willing to give to us if we are willing to make a little effort." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "May blessings be upon the head of Cadmus, the Phoenicians, or whoever it was that invented books." -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Melissa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Daniel J. Boorstin
item.description: "A wonderful thing about a book, in contrast to a computer screen, is that you can take it to bed with you." -- Daniel J. Boorstin

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Lenore Hershey
item.description: "Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. Theyâ€™re never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal." -- Lenore Hershey

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The difference between literature and journalism is that journalism is unreadable and literature is not read." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "When you sell a man a book you don't sell just twelve ounces of paper and ink and glue - you sell him a whole new life. Love and friendship and humour and ships at sea by night - there's all heaven and earth in a book, a real book." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Some books leave us free and some books make us free." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Barbara Tuchman
item.description:
"Books are the carriers of civilization. Without books, history is silent, literature dumb, science crippled, thought and speculation at a standstill. Without books, the development of civilization would have been impossible. They are engines of change (as the poet said), windows on the world and lighthouses erected in the sea of time. They are companions, teachers, magicians, bankers of the treasures of the mind. Books are humanity in print.
[<i>Bulletin of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</i>, Vol. 34, No. 2 (Nov. 1980), pp. 16-32]" -- Barbara Tuchman

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Books are the mirrors of the soul." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "After all, reading is arguably a far more creative and imaginative process than writing; when the reader creates emotion in their head, or the colors of the sky during the setting sun, or the smell of a warm summer's breeze on their face, they should reserve as much praise for themselves as they do for the writer - perhaps more." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "The summer movies are coming out. My advice: just stay home and burn a good book." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity and once more in old age, as a fine building should be seen by morning light, at noon and by moonlight." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Helen Exley
item.description: "Books can be dangerous. The best ones should be labeled "This could change your life." -- Helen Exley

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "No man can be called friendless who has God and the companionship of good books." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "We should read to give our souls a chance to luxuriate." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Helene Hanff
item.description: "I do love secondhand books that open to the page some previous owner read oftenest. The day Hazlitt came he opened to "I hate to read new books," and I hollered "Comrade!" to whoever owned it before me." -- Helene Hanff

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "There is more treasure in books than in all the pirates' loot on Treasure Island and best of all, you can enjoy these riches every day of your life." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Harry S. Truman
item.description: "Not all readers are leaders, but all leaders are readers." -- Harry S. Truman

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "Books are not made for furniture, but there is nothing else that so beautifully furnishes a house." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Harold Kushner
item.description: "I think of life as a good book. The further you get into it, the more it begins to make sense." -- Harold Kushner

item.title: Melissa add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "This book taught me, once and for all, how easily you can escape this world with the help of words! You can find friends between the pages of a book, wonderful friends." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Kathleen Thompson Norris
item.description: "Just the knowledge that a good book is awaiting one at the end of a long day makes that day happier. " -- Kathleen Thompson Norris
